content: Is the rust queue always this slow? I don't contribute to rust-lang/rust that often but https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92526 was approved 19 hours ago and is still only 8th in the queue
(And if it isn't, how do I find out why this is happening?)
There are a lot of rollup=never PRs in the queue right now
it'll sort itself out

To elaborate a bite more on what @Jack Huey said. Doing the testing prior to merge generally requires at least 2h30 if not 3h30 sometimes. This extensive testing is done for every pull-request approved and rollup=never. If the queue stay the same (I highly doute that), you're PR will need to wait al least 17.5h (2.5h * 7) before starting the testing and merge process.

I don't have much experience in the recent past, but in the slightly further past (1+ year ago) multi-day waits were common. Particularly because it's a priority queue, so older PRs than yours that get approved will come in ahead of yours (assuming they have the same rollup status). I've had PRs that were next in line and then got bumped down five or more spots.
In short: it's unpredictable; patience is a virtue :smile:
And all this explains why rollups are used a lot
In general, most of my PRs get merged within a day. Rarely (long queue, infra problems) do they get bumped longer
Around 5-6 rollup=never PRs is pretty typical, there are 10 right now
There also seems to have been a lot of timeouts lately
yeah, that also doesn't help
Yeah, the last couple months it's been feeling slower than usual to me

there are a lot of prs that cant be batch-mergen, almost a day of ci-time for these alone.
If your pr is one if those it will take a bit longer
without rollups we would only merge 5-8 prs a day
20 hours later and itâ€™s further from the front of the queue than it was before
Shit.
@matthiaskrgr Have a look at this. https://github.com/rust-lang-ci/rust/runs/4741251687?check_suite_focus=true
I think all those times the CI has looked jammed it might have actually been running.
Or I'm misreading this, which is also possible.
weird, why would it not print anything while running though
do you also just see the "configure: ..:" stuff, or actual cargo build output?
oh it loaded now
I didn't see anything while it was running either.
It's weird as all hell.
But it's also strange that none of the other prs that ran in between have succeeded :/
https://bors.rust-lang.org/retry_log/rust
Wait, where are you getting that?
That log only shows ones that got retried, I think?
Let's see what happens with #92592.
getting what?
yeah i think it's just a list of all "@bors retry" comments essentially :upside_down:

matthiaskrgr said:

weird, why would it not print anything while running though

I've had this happen before; I think it's some weird GHA bug.
Sometimes I can't see the logs until after the build is finished (passed or failed)
It's two from the front now :)
